reviews.review_msg: He is a very good preceptor, he explains the concepts clearly, and he has a nice sense of humor.

This guy is awesome!! I didn't think computer science was for me, and I struggled in the beginning - but he did tutorials and answers question, and I pulled through. I enjoyed his attempts (sometimes failed) to make the topic relatable: like showing use plagiarism detection program. Too many labs to submit though.

I had no prior programming experience, but found the course very easy. The tests had questions very similar to the ones from class and from the homework; we were also allowed to bring crib sheets. There were plenty of opportunities to get bonus marks. There were also many optional tutorials for extra help.

This prof is really dynamic, and while his humour is terrible it made most classes almost fun. Lots of clicker questions were usaful to check that I got what was going on. Textbook use is abysmal - officially there is a study guide, but it does not follow the course. But I got as much help from the prof as I needed with office hours. Great guy!!
Nice guy, exams were pretty fair, lectures were good enough, etc. Grading was very slow but that might be the TAs' fault.

Jérémie is a good professor. His lectures are straightforward and provides his lecture notes after the class is done. I would have liked to see a textbook be used though to further understand the material, sometimes just the class examples aren't sufficient enough to do assignments and labs. Exams are fair. But overall, he's a decent prof!

Jérémie is an excellent lecturer. Not only is he passionate about what he teaches, he actually knows how to teach! Not to mention that he has a very good sense of humour and was ALWAYS available for help at your request. Good Guy Lumbroso.

He's a wonderful and adorakable professor! He's fully invested in the students he teach; Jeremie holds extra office hours all most all the time. He explains material properly and clearly and tries his best to accommodate his students.
Excellent prof, funny, helpful and fairly easy course. The only thing that he could improve on would be clarifying deadlines and what to do in lab a day before or so.
I would say this prof is passionate, and he's an easy grader. But I wish he followed a textbook because his lectures are not sufficient.

Simply abysmal. Has no idea how to teach. Passionate, and knows his stuff, but utterly unprepared to teach an intro class. Was obviously thrown into this by his department, and we've all suffered as a consequence. Avoid.

Worst prof ever! Doesn't explain material properly. The matherial by the way is useless. We just did python which is not applicable in real life. If you ar ethinking of taking any CMPT class never take CMPT120 and never take anything with Lumbroso!

Please if you do not have ANY background knowledge on programming of any kind DROP THE COURSE. This prof does not explain how you should go about doing homework and lab and lecture slides does not relate to homework at all. he changes from powerpoint lecture to scribbling non-legible words on the overhead for no reason.
Very funny, quite interesting. Cute accent. :)

Dude very clearly knows his stuff. Coding in this course is super math-based and it's pretty unlikely that you'll understand more than 80% of the stuff. If you don't make sure you understand the weekly topics, you WILL be dragged behind. Do the lab exercises instead of talking to your friends

You will get partial credit for incomplete test answers
